intro: Jamesbrittenia integerrima, commonly known as the rigid Jamesbrittenia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to South Africa and is characterized by its upright growth habit and distinctive, elongated leaves. The plant produces showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in summer, attracting various pollinators. It is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun exposure. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
